qas.question: In general, what does immunology study?
Immunology studies the functioning of the immune system in which two states of being?
Name three types of immunological disorders?

answers.text: autoimmune diseases, hypersensitivities, immune deficiency, and transplant rejection

qas.question: Immunology studies the immune system in which three stages of existence?

answers.text: in vitro, in situ, and in vivo

qas.question: What disciplines in medicine have particularly strong immunology applications?

answers.text: organ transplantation, oncology, virology, bacteriology, parasitology, psychiatry, and dermatology

context: Immunology is a branch of biomedical science that covers the study of <a0_0>immune systems in all organisms<a0_0/>. It charts, measures, and contextualizes the: physiological functioning of the immune system in states of <a1_0>both health and diseases<a1_0/>; malfunctions of the immune system in immunological disorders (such as <a2_0>autoimmune diseases, hypersensitivities, immune deficiency, and transplant rejection<a2_0/>); the physical, chemical and physiological characteristics of the components of the immune system <a3_0>in vitro, in situ, and in vivo<a3_0/>. Immunology has applications in numerous disciplines of medicine, particularly in the fields of <a4_0>organ transplantation, oncology, virology, bacteriology, parasitology, psychiatry, and dermatology<a4_0/>.
